messages: 3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:42): onLoad="" isn't strict html  ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:43): babo_: It is
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:44): Dorward: it's showing as a validator error for strict though ... ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:44): babo_: For what element?
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (20:45): babo_ onload="" (no capital) is valid for the <body> element
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (20:45): and frameset
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (20:45): (well should be)
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:45): onLoad is valid for the body element in HTML.
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:45): hmm ... and onclick instead of onClick right ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:45): babo_: onClick is fine
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:45): babo_: ... in HTML.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:45): babo_: You aren't using XHTML are you?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (20:46): onclick
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:46): Dorward: yeah, I guess so
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:46): babo_: You guess so? Don't you know?
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:46): Dorward: yes, I'm using xhtml
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:47): XHTML 1.0 Transitional
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:47): babo_: Ah. That would be the problem then. You're probably better off with HTML 4.01 ... and Strict rather than Transitional.
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (20:47): Dorward: Ok cool thanks
66cf090a7468d3bd4564c043bbe20840 (21:02): hello, could i put a form inside another form? in case negative, what alternatives are there?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:02): pesadilla: No. Rather depends on what problem you are trying to solve.
66cf090a7468d3bd4564c043bbe20840 (21:03): I have two forms, and inside the first form i have another form to upload a file.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:03): And why is one inside the other?
66cf090a7468d3bd4564c043bbe20840 (21:04): good question, because is a table with a lot of input text
66cf090a7468d3bd4564c043bbe20840 (21:04): and i try upload a file in a row, and then submit the first form
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:05): So if I set the width of a table to be say, 580px. And the width of the elements in the column of that table are say 600px ... what should happen ?
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:05): It should obey my width right ?
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:06): I've set style="overflow:none;"  ...
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:06): babo_: The "automatic table layout algorithm" is rather more complex then that, in short "no".
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:06): Dorward: arr ...
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:06): how do I get it to 'obey' me then ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:07): babo_: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/tables.html#width-layout
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:07): babo_: Keep in mind that that is a draft.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:07): babo_: and some of that automatic table layout algorithm is marked as being "at risk"
0f33dc2f69534e8053d1d1b2f5588176 (21:08): I have a table cell containing text followed by an <input>, how can I indicate that I do not want a line break between the text and input?
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:08): Dorward: I guess there's no shortcut then ? ... like a style directive or something ... ?
66cf090a7468d3bd4564c043bbe20840 (21:08): Dorward, very thanks for answer before, i will change my strategy, thanks
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:09): babo_: Err. I'm not sure as I've never felt the need, but I thought there was. Did you read the section of the spec I just referenced?
3ee66a0e3b3b5361a1b2d79e1fb730e0 (21:10): Dorward: yeah, fixed table layout ... it's not working for me at the moment though ...
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:10): Ah

5fd4cd493817f963acc0ab7d2186ac7b (21:10): I really do need to use CData when I am writing a tag in a javascript string, right? Because when I turn encode the < in entities, the javascript engine does not unescape it, so I get the encoded entities int he string :(
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:12): Fullmoon_mobile: Errr... the XML parser should unescape it.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:13): Fullmoon_mobile: Unless you are serving XHTML 1.1 as text/html ... which you shouldn't be.
5fd4cd493817f963acc0ab7d2186ac7b (21:13): Dorward: Damn it, that is it! It seems that server header overrides meta declaration
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:13): Fullmoon_mobile: XHTML isn't really suitable for serving to end users at present. The support just isn't there.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (21:13): Fullmoon_mobile: Well yes. The meta declaration is basically junk. HTTP headers are authoriative.
5fd4cd493817f963acc0ab7d2186ac7b (21:14): Dorward: Ah, I did not knew, I always thought it to be the other way around
5fd4cd493817f963acc0ab7d2186ac7b (21:15): Dorward: Serving XHTML 1.1 as text/html is no problem though, right?

71d230bda423edc0a57268ee0163652a (21:34): good day, I'm having trouble with a really weird page.  There are 3 <html> tags in this page, I know, all wrong, and I want to know if it's possible to have a style from 1 affect any of the others.  Do you know if this is possible?
